meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Nicole Willson Drew Bayers William Castañeda Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #6265.

td.p: Nicole Willson, a web designer from Centerville, Virginia
Drew Bayers, a music supervisor originally from Milford, Connecticut
William Castañeda, a human resources professional from San Francisco, California (whose 1-day cash winnings total $9,400)

tr.td: BODIES OF WATER
HIP HOP HOOPSTERS
CAIN & ABEL
FIRST LADIES
CANCELED!
TRANSPOSITION WORDS
(Alex: Each correct response will be a shorter word that can be formed from the letters in "transposition".)

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', 'This 315-mile-long river passes through Troy & Albany before hitting the bright lights of New York City')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: This 315-mile-long river passes through Troy & Albany before hitting the bright lights of New York City

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_4_2', 'clue_J_4_2_stuck', '(Kelly of the Clue Crew reports from a presidential library.) In letters from 1840, she wrote both ways on the page to save paper & money; ironically, she was pilloried by the press for spending too much as First Lady')

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_J_5_2', 'clue_J_5_2_stuck', '(Alex: You are right, yes, the eruption on Iceland, and that takes you into second place with $600. I\'m sure you will welcome this break to gather yourselves and make the big charge against William when we come back.)

a volcanic eruption

Nicole
')

Drew
Nicole

THE WORLD PRESS
WHAT A 19th CENTURY CHARACTER
CLASSICAL GAS
BIOPIC SUBJECTS

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', '(Alex: The line was, "There is no doubt that... the feared \'European War\'... will become a world war in the full sense of the word.")
[NOTE: As the clue suggested, the quote was actually "There is no doubt that... the feared "European War"... will become the [*] in the full sense of the word."]
DrewWhat is the \'First\' World War?
$6,400
WilliamWhat is the first world?
$15,200
NicoleWhat is World War I?
$9,801
First World War')

William
Drew
Nicole
3rd place: $1,000
New champion: $19,200
2nd place: $2,000
William
Drew
Nicole

(including 1 DD),
3 W

The Jeopardy! game show and all elements thereof, including but not limited to copyright and trademark thereto, are the property of Jeopardy Productions, Inc. and are protected under law.
